item.title: Ticket #2075 (Breaking post content) updated
item.dc:creator: michele
item.description: Priority, Component changed

item.title: Ticket #2075 (Breaking post content) created
item.dc:creator: michele
item.description:
Wordpress breaks a post if the content is the following: 

<blockquote>
<code><div></code>
<code><ul></code>
<code><li><a href="/">home</a></li></code>
<code><li><a href="/about/">about</a></li></code>
<code><li><a href="/services/">services</a></li></code>
<code><li><a href="/work/">portfolio</a></li></code>
<code></ul></code>
</code></div></code>
</blockquote>

When you save it, it becomes: 

<blockquote>
<code><div></div></code>
<code><ul></ul></code>
<code><li><a href="/">home</a></li></code>
<code><li><a href="/about/">about</a></li></code>
<code><li><a href="/services/">services</a></li></code>
<code><li><a href="/work/">portfolio</a></li></code>
<code></code>
</blockquote>

item.title: Ticket #2074 (The attachment system is pretty lame ;-)) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Escaped string and fixed typo in update_post_meta()

Fixed wp_handle_upload() mime checking routine

Added attachment and page search to classes.php

Added search to Manage >> Pages

Added Manage >> Attachments

Added support for mime-specific icons

Created audio.jpg for default theme

Improved default theme handling of attachments

Fixed header text when viewing comments in edit.php

$wp_query->post is assigned by reference

Deleting attachments also deletes unused thumbs

item.title: Ticket #2071 (some page gives 404 after reordering) updated
item.dc:creator: dissurion
item.description:
Think I've found the pattern: it gives a 404 for every page whose id is higher than it's parent when that parent has a smaller id than it's parent.

my setup for a page:

18 p 3 — b 4 — c 14 — — t 5 — te 10 — — ar 7 — — — in 8 — — — — so 11 — — — som 13 — — — — qs 12 — — — qsfd

the following pages give a 404: t, ar, so

item.title: Ticket #2068 (inline-uploading leaves thumbnail on disk even after deleting original ...) created
item.dc:creator: itdamager
item.description:
This seems to fix it. I see no reason to run an is_file() to check for its existence since unlink errors are suppressed. 

Index: wp-includes/functions-post.php
===================================================================
--- wp-includes/functions-post.php	(revision 3294)
+++ wp-includes/functions-post.php	(working copy)
@@ -357,8 +357,11 @@
 	if ( ! empty($meta['file']) )
 		@ unlink($meta['file']);
-	if ( ! empty($file) )
+	if ( ! empty($file) ) {
 		@ unlink($file);
+		$pathparts = pathinfo($file);
+		@ unlink($pathparts['dirname']."/thumb-".$pathparts['basename']);
+	}
 	do_action('delete_attachment', $postid);

item.title: Ticket #2066 (Category Dropdown in sidebar does not have Correct Permalinks) created
item.dc:creator: so1o
item.description:
The category in the sidebar creates values for category in CatID's although i have the permalinks for the category set as "/category".

so when i am at an archive page at the following link <weburl>/2005/12/12/327

it submits the category dropdown to <weburl>/2005/12/12/327?cat=3&submit=GO

First: even if CatIDs are used they should be posted to the base URL. Second: better option is to post the Permalink

item.title: Ticket #2053 (Emails being sent with bogus "From:" header) updated
item.dc:creator: sjmurdoch
item.description:
I asked someone who knows far more about email than me and he agreed that there is no reliable way to generate a valid "From:" header. His suggestion was to ask for this during the setup process, but give a few options, for example wordpress@SERVER_NAME, get_settings('admin_email'), or custom.

As for a default, he suggested that using get_settings('admin_email') is the one most likely to get mail through, as it is the only one that is guaranteed to be a valid email address.

item.title: Ticket #2065 (Problems using right hand side select lists when creating/editing ...) created
item.dc:creator: roblgs
item.description:
In the main pages for pages/posts all select lists in the disclosable areas at righthand side of the wysiwyg editor are inoperative, rendering the selection of page parent, page/post author, month, page template impossible.

The select list in the custom tags area of the page editor also appears to be dead in the water.

Select lists elsewhere (not in revealable divs) are working perfectly OK.

Mac OSX 10.3.9, Firefox 1.5, WP2B2 and WP2RC1

item.title: Ticket #2064 (RTE Doesn't Work with gzip Code) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Owner, Status changed

Others have had this issue some but not all servers. It is a configuration conflict between ob_gzhandler and something else... we just need somebody who is having this problem to commit some time to debugging it.

What is different about the problem server? Will you post the URL of the bad server and one of your good ones? Please gmail skeltoac for debugging assistance.

item.title: Ticket #2064 (RTE Doesn't Work with gzip Code) created
item.dc:creator: fool4Christ
item.description:
Using 2005/12/12 nightly with RTE on by default in Writing options and User options while working on Firefox 1.5, the RTE editor does not load and quicktags are shown instead.

Deleting this: 

	// Only gzip the contents if clients and server support it
	$encodings = explode(',', strtolower($_SERVER['HTTP_ACCEPT_ENCODING']));
	if (in_array('gzip', $encodings) && function_exists('ob_gzhandler'))
		@ ob_start("ob_gzhandler"); // Don't let warnings foul up the JS

from tiny_mce_gzip.php solves the problem and the RTE editor loads just fine.

This only happens on one of my subdomains; on another subdomain on the same server the RTE loads just fine everytime, regardless of the gzip code.

item.title: Ticket #2058 (TinyMCE editor adding border attribute) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Keywords, Owner changed

Updates to TinyMCE: Removed forced table border, added full XHTML 1.0 Transitional set for unfiltered_html, API improvements, JS moved from admin-header.php to tiny_mce_gzip.php

The border attribute will no longer be added automatically. If you want to change the allowed HTML set to adhere to a different doctype, you must use the new mce_valid_elements filter.
